answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links that may be helpful.
The City of Tempe, AZ uses a Mobile Recycling Education Center to help educate residents on the benefits of recycling.
http://icma.org/en/Article/100119/Tempe_AZ_Starts_Mobile_Recycling_Education_Center
This PowerPoint presentation details textile recycling programs provided by the organization USAgain.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303252/Charting_a_Course_to_Zero_Waste
In Highland Park, IL they developed the Commercial and Multi-Family Waste and Recycling Franchise, which helps provide flat-rate, affordable recycling. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302312/2010_ICMA_Community_Sustainability_Award_Nominee_Highland_Park_Commercial_and_MultiFamily_Waste_and_
Wake County, North Carolina's developed the “Feed the Bin School Recycling Program” to help encourage mixed paper recycling at Wake County public schools. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302334/2010_ICMA_Community_Sustainability_Award_Nominee_Feed_the_Bin_School_Recycling_Program
The City of Aurora created the Environment Aurora Program to promote over sustainability through e-waste recycling events, single stream recycling, and cooking oil recycling.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/100210/Environment_Aurora
The Mesa, AZ Community Recycling Partnerships Program helped bring together Mesa's Solid Waste Management and Mesa’s Public School District in an effort to enhance recycling. So far they have helped save the community over $3,000 a month. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302325/2010_ICMA_Community_Sustainability_Award_Nominee_Community_Recycling_Program
Alachua County, FL hosts a “Trashformations” Recycled Art Competition every year to help promote recycling. 
http://icma.org/en/Article/101494/Alachua_County_FL_Hosts_13th_Annual_Trashformations_Recycled_Art_Competition
The Anoka County “Cash from Trash” program allows businesses to create recycling plans that fit their institution.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/100040/Anoka_Countys_Cash_from_Trash_Program
For more examples of recycling programs you can also visit the Knowledge Network Recycling Topic Page.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/topic/227/recycling
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org
